cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles ESE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move slowly northwest then north-northwest, skirting the east coast of Florida before turning northeast away from the U.S. Southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along or very near the southeast Florida coast, closest to Palm Beach County

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch issued from Jupiter Inlet to Flagler-Volusia County line (just north of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the north-western Bahamas (excluding Andros Island)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and east-central Florida coastline, including Palm Beach County, then northward to the Georgia/South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–39+ kt) are possible Saturday, with cumulative chances near 1 in 3
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; NHC notes no significant surge with this system along Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: Periodic squalls could produce 2–4 inches of rain over Palm Beach County Saturday–Sunday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions in and near the port approaches
